se.code77.jq

Class JQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.code77.jq.JQ

  • public final class JQ
extends java.lang.Object
    JQ is a promise implementation in Java, aiming to conform to the Promises/A+ specification. See the overview for more info on promises and code examples.
    The JQ class itself contains static helpers and convenience methods related to promises. For example defer(), defer(DeferredHandler) and defer(Callable) used to create new promises that will be connected to a task and returned to clients, as well as various helper methods related to synchronization of multiple promises etc. It also contains static counterparts to most instance methods on Promise.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JQ.Deferred<V>
      A deferred object is used by methods implementing asynchronous operations exposed by promises.
      static interface  JQ.DeferredHandler<V>
      Callback interface used by deferrer to get access to the Deferred object
      static class  JQ.OnFulfilledVoidCallback<V>
      Convenience for the case where you want to transform a promised value to void, i.e., ((Void)null), for example if an operation you need to wait upon returns a promise for a String but you simply want to return an empty promise used for observing when the complete operation is complete.

    • Method Detail

      • defer

        public static <V> JQ.Deferred<V> defer()
        Creates a new promise and an associated Deferred object used to modify the state of the promise. Clients should only gain access to the Promise object and may only observe the state. The deferrer should carry out the task at hand and upon completion resolve or reject the promise by calling JQ.Deferred.resolve(Object) or JQ.Deferred.reject(Exception), respectively. 
         final Deferred<String> deferred = JQ.defer();
 
 new Thread() {
     public void run() {
         // do some lengthy task
         deferred.resolve("Hello world");
     }
 }.start();

 return deferred.promise;
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of value to be carried in the promise
        Returns:
        Deferred object
        See Also:
        defer(DeferredHandler)

      • defer

        public static <V> Promise<V> defer(JQ.DeferredHandler<V> dh)
        Alternative way of creating a deferred object, offering a compact way of inlining the code that handles the task and resolves/rejects the promise, while returning the promise in one single method call. Note that unlike defer(Callable, Executor), the JQ.DeferredHandler will be invoked on the calling thread and will have to manually spawn any background threads etc as needed. 
         Promise<String> p = JQ.defer(new DeferredHandler<String>() {
     public void handle(final Deferred<String> deferred) {
         new Thread() {
             public void run() {
                 // do some lengthy task
                 deferred.resolve("Hello world");
             }
         }.start();
     }
 });
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value to be carried by the promise
        Parameters:
        dh - DeferredHandler callback interface using the Deferred object to resolve or reject the promise upon task completion.
        Returns:
        A new promise for the task
        See Also:
        defer()

      • defer

        public static <V> Promise<V> defer(java.util.concurrent.Callable<V> task)
        Alternative way of creating a deferred object by running the given task using a default cached thread pool executor, resolving/rejecting the associated promise with the result of the task execution, and returning the promise. 
         Promise<String> p = JQ.defer(new Callable<String>() {
     public String call() {
         return "Hello world";
     }
 });
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value to be carried by the promise
        Parameters:
        task - The task to run. The result returned from the task will be used to resolve the promise, if any exception is thrown it will be used to reject the promise.
        Returns:
        A new promise for the task
        See Also:
        defer(Callable, Executor)

      • defer

        public static <V> Promise<V> defer(java.util.concurrent.Callable<V> task,
                                   java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Alternative way of creating a deferred object by running the given task using the given executor, resolving/rejecting the associated promise with the result of the task execution, and returning the promise.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value to be carried by the promise
        Parameters:
        task - The task to run. The result returned from the task will be used to resolve the promise, if any exception is thrown it will be used to reject the promise.
        executor - Executor to run the task
        Returns:
        A new promise for the task
        See Also:
         Promise<String> p = JQ.defer(myExec, new Callable<String>() {
     public String call() {
         return "Hello world";
     }
 });

      • resolve

        public static <V> Promise<V> resolve(V value)
        Create a pre-resolved promise for a simple, immediately available value.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value to be carried by the promise
        Parameters:
        value - Value to resolve the promise with
        Returns:
        New promise

      • resolve

        public static Promise<java.lang.Void> resolve()
        Create a promise for a void (non-)value. Effectively this is just a way of starting a promise chain. It can be useful in situations where branches in the code causes a series of asynchronous operations to be called sometimes, and sometimes not. By starting the chain of promise calls with a resolve(), the following callbacks may return either values or new promises to further calls, they will be properly resolved and propagated into a promise regardless.
        Returns:
        A new promise

      • wrap

        public static <V> Promise<V> wrap(java.util.concurrent.Future<V> future)
        Wrap a Future in a promise. Once the future is done, the promise will be resolved or rejected depending on the outcome. If future is already a promise, future itself will be returned by this method.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value to be carried by the promise
        Parameters:
        future - Future to wrap
        Returns:
        New promise

      • reject

        public static <T> Promise<T> reject(java.lang.Exception reason)
        Create a pre-rejected promise for the given exception
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the value to be carried by the return promise
        Parameters:
        reason - Exception to reject the promise with
        Returns:
        A new promise

      • when

        public static <V,NV> Promise<NV> when(V value,
                                      Promise.OnFulfilledCallback<V,NV> onFulfilled,
                                      Promise.OnRejectedCallback<NV> onRejected)
        Static convenience version of then. This method is equivalent to JQ.resolve(value).then(onFulfilled, onRejected).
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value to be carried by the promise
        NV - Type of the value to be returned by the callback handlers
        Parameters:
        value - Value to resolve the promise with
        onFulfilled - Fulfillment handler
        onRejected - Rejection handler
        Returns:
        A new promise that will be resolved with the value returned/rejected with the reason thrown from any of the callback handlers.
        See Also:
        Promise.then(OnFulfilledCallback, OnRejectedCallback)

      • timeout

        public static <V> Promise<V> timeout(Promise<V> promise,
                                     long ms)
        Static convenience version of Promise.timeout(long). Adds a timeout to a promise by returning a new promise that will be rejected with a TimeoutException when the specified time has passed if this promise isn't completed by then.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value carried by the promise
        Parameters:
        promise - Promise to add a timeout to
        ms - Timeout, in milliseconds
        Returns:
        New promise
        See Also:
        Promise.timeout(long)

      • delay

        public static <V> Promise<V> delay(Promise<V> promise,
                                   long ms)
        Static convenience version of Promise.delay(long). Delays a resolved promise by the specified time, by creating a new promise that will inherit the state of this promise; if this promise is rejected, the new promise will also be immediately rejected but if this promise is resolved, the new promise will be resolved when the specified time has passed.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value carried by the promise
        Parameters:
        promise - Promise to add a timeout to
        ms - Time to delay resolved promise, in milliseconds
        Returns:
        New promise
        See Also:
        Promise.delay(long)

      • join

        public static <V> Promise<V> join(Promise<V> p1,
                                  Promise<V> p2)
        Static convenience version of Promise.join(Promise). Creates a new promise that will wait for the two promises to complete, and which will be resolved if and only if the two promises are resolved with the exact same value. If any of the promises are rejected, the new promise will be immediately rejected as well. If both promises are resolved but with different values, the new promise will be rejected.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value carried by the promises
        Parameters:
        p1 - A promise
        p2 - A promise
        Returns:
        A promise that will be resolved only if both promises are resolved with the same value; rejected otherwise
        See Also:
        Promise.join(Promise)

      • all

        public static <V> Promise<java.util.List<V>> all(java.util.List<Promise<V>> promises)
        Creates a promise that will be resolved when all promises in a supplied set are resolved. If any promise in the list is rejected, the returned promise will also be immediately rejected. This can be used to synchronize a set of parallel operations.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value carried by the promises
        Parameters:
        promises - Set of promises
        Returns:
        A new promise, awaiting the resolution of all promises in the set

      • all

        @SafeVarargs
public static <V> Promise<java.util.List<V>> all(Promise<V>... promises)
        Creates a promise that will be resolved when all promises in a supplied set are resolved. If any promise in the list is rejected, the returned promise will also be immediately rejected. This can be used to synchronize a set of parallel operations.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value carried by the promises
        Parameters:
        promises - Set of promises
        Returns:
        A new promise, awaiting the resolution of all promises in the set

      • any

        public static <V> Promise<V> any(java.util.List<Promise<V>> promises)
        Creates a promise that will be resolved as soon as any promise in a supplied set is resolved. If all promises in the list are rejected, the returned promise will also be rejected. This can be used to find the quickest way of completing a task that can be carried out in several ways in parallel.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value carried by the promises
        Parameters:
        promises - Set of promises
        Returns:
        A new promise, awaiting the resolution of the single quickest promise to be resolved in the set

      • allSettled

        public static <V> Promise<java.util.List<Promise.StateSnapshot<V>>> allSettled(java.util.List<Promise<V>> promises)
        Creates a promise that will be resolved as soon as all promises in a supplied set are completed, i.e., either resolved or rejected. The returned promise is hence never rejected.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value carried by the promises
        Parameters:
        promises - Set of promises
        Returns:
        A new promise, awaiting the completion of all promises in the set

      • race

        public static <V> Promise<V> race(java.util.List<Promise<V>> promises)
        Creates a promise that will inherit the state of the first promise in the supplied set to be completed, i.e., either resolved or rejected. This can be used to find the quickest way of completing a task that can be carried out in several ways in parallel, disregarding whether the task completed successfully or not.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of the value carried by the promises
        Parameters:
        promises - Set of promises
        Returns:
        A new promise, awaiting the completion of the single quickest promise to be completed in the set
